metadata.primary_source_paper: Raup, D. M. (1966). Geometric Analysis of Shell Coiling: General Problems. Journal of Paleontology, 40(5), 1178-1190.
metadata.original_introduction: Raup, D. M. (1962). Computer as Aid in Describing Form in Gastropod Shells. Science, 138(3537), 150-152.
metadata.ammonoid_application: Raup, D. M. (1967). Geometric Analysis of Shell Coiling: Coiling in Ammonoids. Journal of Paleontology, 41(1), 43-65.
metadata.note: The three-parameter model (W, D, T) was first introduced in Raup (1962). The 1966 paper provides the detailed mathematical formulation. The 1967 paper applies the model to ammonoids.

W.name: Whorl Expansion Rate
W.definition: The rate at which the shell radius increases per full revolution (2π radians)
W.effect: Higher W = wider, more rapidly expanding shells

D.name: Distance from Coiling Axis
D.definition: The distance of the inner edge of the shell from the coiling axis, normalized (0 to 1)
D.effect: D=0 = tight coiling (no umbilicus), higher D = more open/disc-like forms

T.name: Translation Rate
T.definition: The vertical rise per radian along the coiling axis
T.effect: T=0 = planispiral (flat), higher T = elongated, turreted forms

S.name: Shape of Generating Curve
S.definition: Aspect ratio of the generating curve (aperture cross-section)
S.effect: S=1 = circular, S>1 = wider than tall, S<1 = taller than wide
